conclusion: Determine if heat absorbed is greater than heat released by analyzing the p-V diagram.
Process A to B is isochoric with increasing pressure.
In process A to B, no work is done, so QAB = ΔUAB.
Process B to C is adiabatic with increasing volume and decreasing pressure.
In process B to C, no heat is exchanged, so WBC = ΔUBC.
Process C to D is isochoric with decreasing pressure.
In process C to D, no work is done, so QCD = ΔUCD.
Process D to A is adiabatic with decreasing volume and increasing pressure.
In process D to A, no heat is exchanged, so WDA = ΔUDA.
During A to B, the gas absorbs heat as pressure increases.
During C to D, the gas releases heat as pressure decreases.
Net work done by the system is the area enclosed by the p-V diagram, which is positive.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
For a complete cycle, ΔU = 0, so Q = W.
Since net work done is positive, total heat absorbed (QAB) is greater than total heat released (QCD).
